head.title: World Briefing | Asia: Koreas: Talks Get Under Way

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Asia: Koreas: Talks Get Under Way

abstract.p: North and South Korea begin first cabinet-level talks since Nov 2001, discussing construction of across-the-border rail line and reunions for families separated by Korean War; leader of North Korean delegation Kim Ryong Song is optimistic about outcome (S)

block.p: North and South Korea started their first cabinet-level talks since November, discussing construction of an across-the-border rail line and the renewal of reunions for families separated half a century ago by the Korean War. Part of a flurry of diplomatic activity by North Korea, the three-day meeting began on a positive note. ''You may think optimistically,'' Kim Ryong Song, leader of the 29-member North Korean delegation, said after the first day of talks ended. He added, ''There are prospects that the fruit can grow bigger and bigger.''
